arts.ttl: Santiago Castro: “Don’t call me Lautaro. Trash talking gives me energy”
arts.sum: Santiago Castro, the 20-year-old Argentine striker making waves at Bologna, has quickly become one of Serie A’s most intriguing prospects. Speaking In an interview with La Gazzetta dello Sport, Castro opened up about his playing style, his journey to Bologna, and his aspirations for the future. The young forward, often compared to Inter Milan’s Lautaro Martinez, is eager to carve out his own identity in Italian football. “At first, I was proud of the comparison because he’s one of my idols, like Tevez was. But now I prefer to be talked about for who I am. I want to be The post Santiago Castro: “Don’t call me Lautaro. Trash talking gives me energy” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Bologna vs Venezia looking to bounce back
arts.sum: Bologna are one of only four teams - along with Lazio, Fiorentina and Juventus - not to have lost at home yet in Serie A this season (W1 D4); only twice in the three-point-per-win era (since 1994/95) have the Felsineiremained unbeaten in their first six home games in a Serie A championship: in 2002/03 and 2010/11.. After going undefeated for 14 consecutive games (W7 D7) against Venezia in Serie A, Bologna have lost their last two matches and could suffer three defeats in a row against the Veneti for the first time in the competition.

arts.ttl: Venezia’s Di Francesco: “Sacking? It’s the last thing on my mind”
arts.sum: Venezia manager Eusebio Di Francesco addressed the media ahead of his team’s crucial match against Bologna following a disappointing defeat to Lecce. The loss has raised questions about his future, but Di Francesco remains focused on the task at hand. Reflecting on the mental and physical state of his squad, Di Francesco stated, “We have some doubts regarding Nicolussi Caviglia due to a minor issue, Anderson will be absent for family reasons, and Zampano is out with a hand problem. We hope to recover him for the next match. Mentally, we have licked our wounds after a match where we The post Venezia’s Di Francesco: “Sacking? It’s the last thing on my mind” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Bologna v Venezia: Match Preview
arts.sum: Bologna will look to regain their footing in Serie A as they face off against Venezia at Stadio Renato Dall’Ara on Saturday. Following a disappointing week in Europe, the Rossoblu are eager to secure a much-needed victory against the struggling Lagunari, who currently occupy the bottom position in the league. Bologna enter this match after suffering a setback in their Champions League campaign, where they faced Lille and lost 2-1. Despite Colombian center-back Jhon Lucumi making history by scoring Bologna’s first goal in their inaugural Champions League season, it wasn’t enough to prevent defeat. arts.ttl: OFFICIAL: Bologna secure Aebischer’s future with contract extension to 2027
arts.sum: Bologna have officially announced the contract renewal of midfielder Michel Aebischer. The 27-year-old Swiss international has extended his commitment to the Rossoblu, with his new contract set to run until June 30, 2027, including an option for an additional year. The club made the announcement through their official website and social media channels, stating: “Bologna FC 1909 announces that an agreement has been reached with midfielder Michel Aebischer for the extension of his contract until June 30, 2027, with an option for an additional season.” This news comes as a positive development for manager Vincenzo Italiano, who is eagerly awaiting The post OFFICIAL: Bologna secure Aebischer’s future with contract extension to 2027 appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Bologna under cyber attack, release statement
arts.sum: Serie A side Bologna have been at the centre of a cyber attack today and the club have released a statement about it. It was reported earlier today that hackers…

arts.ttl: Bologna hit by cyber attack: Hackers demand ransom and leak sensitive data
arts.sum: Bologna, one of Italy’s historic Serie A clubs, is facing a severe cybersecurity crisis. On November 19, the hacker group RansomHub successfully breached the club’s server protection systems, stealing documents, contracts, sensitive data, and a vast amount of other material. The hackers are now demanding a substantial ransom from the club, which has confirmed the breach to authorities. Calciomercato report how the cybercriminals have accessed over 200 gigabytes of data from the club’s servers, including business plans, sponsorship contracts, financial records, personal and confidential information of players, fans, and employees, market strategies (including transfer plans and details on young talents The post Bologna hit by cyber attack: Hackers demand ransom and leak sensitive data appeared first on FootItalia.com.
